alert.note: Alert for Inland Volusia; Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 7:47PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Seminole, east central Lake, northwestern Orange and central Volusia Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 745 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cassia, moving east at 10 mph. Additional strong storms are developing southward to Altamonte Springs and Apopka. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Orlando, Deltona, Sanford, Apopka, and Altamonte Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
